oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Corrosion and passivation behaviour of Al-Zn-Mg alloy - an EIS study
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MITAL, CK
SRINIVASAN, HS
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: aluminum
passivation and dissolution
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Aluminium alloys of 7 XXX series are widely used in aerospace industries because of their higher strength. These alloys contain Zn, Mg and Cu in their matrix which offer the desired mechanical properties. A protective, passive oxide film which is stable in the pH range of 4 to 8 is always present at the surface of these aluminium alloys. However, in chloride containing environments this oxide film undergoes dissolution at imperfect areas, causing pitting type of corrosion.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 5th International Symposium on Advances in Electrochemical Science and Technology,MADRAS, INDIA,NOV 24-26, 1994
